meanings.sent1: She envied her friend's new bike.
meanings.sent2: The little girl envied her sister's colorful dress.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly envied his brother's ability to eat spicy food.
meanings.sent4: The cat envied the freedom of the birds outside.
meanings.sent5: The student envied the teacher's knowledge and experience.

meanings.definition: Desire to have a quality, possession, or other attribute belonging to (someone else).
meanings.sent1: The young artist envied the older painter's skill.
meanings.sent2: Many people envied her talent for playing the piano.
meanings.sent3: The puppy envied the big dog's ability to fetch the ball.
meanings.sent4: The flower envied the attention the rose received.
meanings.sent5: The athlete envied the speed of his competitor.
